The front desk, bell, and bar staff were all friendly and helpful. Room was NY small, but clean. Sleep quality was good with quiet rooms, nice/newer bedding, and good ventilation. Bath is also small, but functional with nice fixtures, good bath products and decent water pressure. Small fitness facilities located on 3 (?) of 18 floors - each with one Cybex treadmill and one elipitical.

Reviews.Title: “I am soooo cold”
Reviews.Author: nycgrl33
Reviews.Content: and I cannot turn on the heat!!! this place is really nice looking, but to food in the mini bar is stale and dusty...which pales in comparision to my freezing here! I cannot adjust the heater in my room. The staff seemed nice and the lobby is great, but unless you love the cold, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the duty manager......”
Reviews.Author: tripabout1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in many ways - Maria on reception was fantastic, rooms generally very good standard, really easy to get to on subway from downtown, quiet location, good value for money on Priceline. On the down side I agree with the other reviews, a four star hotel should not be charging $10 a day for internet use. Unfortunately it seems Hector the duty manager's customer service has seen better days, but aside from that I would still definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Posh Hotel with bad services and unuseful people”
Reviews.Author: MrBigle
Reviews.Content: When you check-in it looks like a nice place to stay but that's not true. When I first arrived to the reception, the lady did not paid attention to my troubles. You need to use a card to take the elevator, like to open the room door. Everybody knows that sometimes it's not easy to use these techniques. The lady only checked my card and looked at me like I was a martian. Once on the bedroom, I've tried to connect my laptop to Internet, troubles again. I had to comeback downstairs 2 times and ask again for my net access. After a 10$ surcharge I realized that the speed of the connection was like in 1995 (slower than turtles doing athletics). I decided to sleep and forget all this things. Today I woke up and it was snowing outdoors, I tried to switch on the heating but it doesn' t work... 120$ for this? Unbelievable.... I'll never visit anymore hotels of this chain. Spend your money in a best NYC place!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with some service problems”
Reviews.Author: gailthegoldfish
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here with a friend. Booked through Hotwire, it's a great value for the money. The hotel's decor is unique for NYC, but the rooms are spacious, the bathrooms have modern, clean fixtures and the bed was very comfortable. The location (in the financial district) is only dissappointing if you aren't expecting to walk or cab anywhere. We knew where the hotel was before we booked and spent a nice half-hour walking to midtown. What better way to get a feel for a city? The service was lacking- we didn't get our requested wake up call (though the alarm clock in the room worked), and one front desk woman was a bit snippy when I asked if they had alternatives to the lavendar soap to which I am allergic. All in all, a nice little boutique hotel that suited my NYC needs.

Reviews.Title: “Should not deserve a 4-star rating”
Reviews.Author: lee_44106
Reviews.Content: Purchase thru Priceline. Touted as 4-stars. At best a 2.5 star hotel along the likes of Holiday Inn. Inconvenient location for a tourist. Room small with little frills. Bed appeared not made when we arrived and had to request a re-make. Gym was dispersed on three separate floors with one each of elliptical/treadmill and free weights. This hotel is ideal for the business traveler to Wall Street who spends little time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: katal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for New Year's eve. We had a nice stay, but we felt that this boutique hotel was not quite as nice as others we have enjoyed in the city. The hotel has a trendy feel to it, an interesting decor, the room was nice but a little dark for our taste, the bed comfortable. The bathroom is also nice but had a few problems. The shower was very nice but we had to play with the stopper (and eventually pull it off without being able to put it back on) to get rid of the water at our feet. More importantly, the toilet was not functioning properly and got clogged. Finally, the bathroom with faux glass walls is nice but if if someone goes into the bathroom at night it lights up the entire room. Be aware that the bar downstairs (next to lobby) appears to be very popular, but perhaps it was only due to New Year's Eve. When we came back to the hotel around 1 AM, the lobby was crowded and the party was raging! we were happy to have a room high up. I point out the problems we encountered but do not mean to suggest that the place was bad. It has character, it is in a quiet location close to the subway , the staff is very nice, and the problems mentioned earlier can be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff Makes this Hotel One of A Kind!”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel0004
Reviews.Content: I visited Gild Hall because I've stayed at the Thompson Hotel in Washington DC and loved it. One of the employees at their DC location recommended it to me. My boyfriend and I were visiting New York for the weekend and the staff truly made us feel like royalty. The front desk managers, Maria and Hector were exceptionally attentive and hospitable. Natalie, the concierge, is sensational! She helped us make dinner reservations, buy tickets, the whole nine yards. This small boutique hotel sets itself apart from the rest with its outstanding customer service and attention to detail. After each day, all the employees welcomed us back using our names. Even the bell staff remembered our names! One final note: spring for the upgrade to the Studio King - the raised ceiling makes you forget you are in the big, bustling city. All around, the accommodations are GREAT!!! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: daveone
Reviews.Content: Western Lodge motif in Lobby/Restaurant which carries into the rooms. Hallways bright red w/ gloss white trim, which I found to be garish. Room small, but reasonably tasteful. I wouldn't want to try and work from the small campaign desk, surprising noting location in the financial district. Very friendly staff. $10 continental breakfast on the weekends. Generally quiet due to location. If you had to stay here, no problem. I wouldn't make an effort to do so. The whole Lodge theme while trying to be hip falls flat. I don't mean to be tough on this place, but it bills itself as a four star. I've stayed at four stars and they all had an elegance and appeal this place lacks. Again it does everything just fine, but if your a leisure traveler and springing for four stars, I think you can find places that are a lot more special. Yes, I would recommend if you get a deal.

Reviews.Title: “If you get stuck here on Priceline...”
Reviews.Author: ryanj31
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Gild Hall this past weekend, not by choice, by courtesy of Priceline. Granted, it was a really busy time in NYC, so we had great difficulty finding a good hotel at a reasonable price. So we tried Priceline and were placed at the Gild Hall. Would never stay here if I had a choice. Rooms were average at best, no service whatsoever (very shortstaffed), terrible location, very few cabs available. The one plus is there wasn't any real "city" noise. But there were a bunch of partiers taking advantage of the cheaper rates making noise late into the night... I say spend a few extra bucks and stay near the action.

Reviews.Title: “nice find”
Reviews.Author: dkfCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends for a weekend in the city. It is in the financial district, which made it very quiet on a Sat and Sun. However, it is a short walk to South Street Seaport and Ground Zero. Room was a deluxe so was a bit larger than usual, bathroom very nice. One draw back (which I had read about on reviews) was the heat/air unit. It cranks on and off and is somewhat loud. The breakfast was $10 all eat continental and was OK not great. The best part was we arrived at hotel around 10am Sat and our rooms were ready. How nice! The staff was friendly. Our valet parking was right across the street so we got our car in minutes of check out.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and easy.”
Reviews.Author: DDPTexas
Reviews.Content: Great find in Wall Street area. Walk to Bankruptcy Court. Nice bar. Reasonably priced restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Stay far away. Wouldn't let my worst enemy stay here.”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTrvlr
Reviews.Content: Even if the room was $99 I wouldn't stay here again. I'll try to distill a long story into a few salient items. 1) The building's HVAC system is set up so that only air or heat will work at one time - i.e. the building needs to switch to heat downstairs in the boiler room. Well think about the Fall when it's warm during the day and cool at night - since the hotel was still set up for A/C there was NO HEAT! And no way to get any heat. Shivering in the room... 2) Service is poor for a hotel of this standard. Was treated curtly by just about everyone. 3) Rooms are a disappointment - they have a few interesting touches, but a lot of empty white walls to stare at. Felt like I was in a big white box. Very uncomfortable. 4) No taxis available -- some others have commented on this and said it was no big deal you just walk 2-3 blocks. Well imagine doing that in a pouring rainstorm or a snowstorm? That becomes a major problem. 5) Location -- terrible even for this part of town. The lobby bar was the only highlight of the place, but not enough to supercede the above points. Next time I stay downtown I'll go to the Andaz.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: theTraveLees
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Location is quiet, peaceful, close to a grocery store and pharmacies, close to subway. We read in one of the reviews that the closest subway stop is closed, and we did see one Fulton St. entrance that is closed, but there are other entrances that are just a few blocks away from the hotel. - Rooms are very nicely appointed and elegant. Our view from the 16th floor still looked right into another apartment building, but it was fine. Bed was very comfortable, decor was nice, fair amount of space. We were concerned about the semi-transparent bathroom wall thing, but it was really a non-issue. You can't really see a thing. - Price was right!! We booked a superior king room for $215/night (on hotelbook.com) for Labor Day weekend. Where else can you find reasonable rates AND quality in NYC?? Cons: - Location is a little out of the way, and nothing nearby is open late, but if you've read the reviews and looked at a map, you should be expecting this. And on the plus side, it is much, much quieter than staying somewhere close to the sights. - The complimentary continental breakfast was a little pitiful. Sad selection and zero table service (couldn't find a napkin, glass of water, or server anywhere in sight). Skip!! - Housekeeping was a little sloppy. We had a couple towels that didn't look very clean, and the soap dish was dirty when we arrived. Not a big deal, but not up to the standard I would have expected, given the rest of the hotel. - Charging $10/day for the internet, esp in the business district, is lame. - No iron in the room - again, for a business district hotel, lame. A note on bedbugs: there are none here, at least as far as we could tell. I checked bedbugregistry.com before we went, and someone had written that they had seen bedbugs in their bathroom at this hotel. I was really worried about this and read tripadvisor reviews obsessively to see if anyone had commented on this, but no one had. When we checked in, my husband and I stripped the bed - checked the comforter, sheets, and mattress, and didn't see anything. We stayed two nights and have been home for a week and don't seem to have brought back any travelers with us. *Whew* I was VERY concerned about this. I told the front desk when we were checking out that I had read about a bedbug complaint online, and he said a few weeks ago, one guest did complain about bedbugs and that they sent up staff to check it out but didn't find anything (or did he say that there might have been bugs, but they were not bedbugs?). I recommended that the hotel dispute the complaint on bedbugregistry.com if it had been determined to be untrue, but he didn't seem too concerned. Anyway, I'm sure plenty of hotels deny any type of bedbug problem, so I appreciated that he was honest about someone reporting it. Just wanted to put this out there, in case anyone else is as paranoid as me! :) Overall, the next time we're in NYC, we would stay here again. A great hotel with fantastic rates, this place is a steal and one of the best deals in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The Gild Hall hotel is a fantastic boutique hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: janiecap
Reviews.Content: We chose the Gild Hall Hotel because we love the Financial District of Manhattan. Since 1999 we have be coming to NYC on a regular basis because our children were students at New York University. Eleven years ago nothing was happening in this district. We stayed downtown because it was cheaper and quieter than other areas. The Battery Park area has/had all the things we loved: quiet, scenery, unique shops, and so much more. When we arrived at the Gild Hall Hotel, we were greeted with a warm welcome. An associate greeted us with immediate service. We wanted the valet parking service which meant he took our luggage out of the car, put it on a cart, directed us to the desk, took the luggage to our room, showed us the features of the room, brought us ice, and parked our car in a safe spot! All the same man! Not ten different people to tip, which gets very confusing. At the check-in desk we met Kelli Phillips. She was amazing! It was our fortieth wedding anniversary, and immediately she upgraded us to a beautiful suite! Our room had a living room with a huge leather sofa, two comfortable chairs, a glass top coffee table an HD LG TV that was fabulous. We also had a kitchenette with a coffee maker, sink, microwave and a small mini-bar fridge. We were able to store our personal items in this fridge. Our bedroom had a fabulous king-sized bed which had very comfortable sheets and pillows. It also had a very large HD LG TV. The bedroom was so comfortable! The bathroom had a huge shower, double sinks, many towels, and CO Bigelow hair and body products. It was awesome! Kelli seemed to be our contact person. I guess she must work 24/7. Donâ€™t know how that works. She seemed to always be there; greeting us and making sure our stay was fantastic! If I needed anything she was there! Great stay! Canâ€™t wait to go back! Kelli was amazing! â€œSurround yourself with good people and let them do their jobs.â€� Obliviously the motto of the Gild Hall Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find, but friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lifeisgood101
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 day convention in Manhattan at the Javits Convention Center and stayed at Gild Hall due to a package air and hotel deal on Expedia. This boutique-style hotel is located in the center of the Business District. PROS: - Incredibly professional service and hospitable staff. This staff stands out from even more high end hotels that we've stayed at as their guest service was impeccable. Warm and welcoming, yet professional and polite. Can I say professional, once again. It is not often that one comes across such well trained, genuine staff in the service industry. - Unique design/decor - Easy access to the subway, one block away. - Comfortable, clean beds. CONS: - Awkward to get to Javits. Taxi ride cost us $13-14 each way every day! Many taxi drivers claimed to not know this hotel and had difficulty finding it tucked away in the Business District. Often had to walk a block or two to find a main artery that taxis frequented as they do not pass by the hotel regularly. Only $6 to/from SoHo. - Not really a touristy hotel as most tourist sites are not within walking distance. - Small rooms and bathroom (no countertop space at all). - Aging finishing. Needs touch-ups on walls, furniture, doorways, etc. - Had to pay $10 for internet per day. In this day and age and in the Business District this should be included in the room cost. If you are primarily going to be located in the Business District, you can't go wrong for service at this hotel. If you are going for pleasure/tourism, I would recommend staying closer to /in Midtown or Times Square area as many more sites are easily walked to and easily accessible. Definitely had higher taxi costs this time that previous visits due to location and wasted time moving about the city to/from here.

Reviews.Title: “No better hotel if you have to stay in financial district”
Reviews.Author: gloandbob
Reviews.Content: For my business trips to NY financial district, I used to stay at the Hilton Millenium, but then the inevitable cut backs from HO surfaced and I had to find an alternative. My NY office booked me the Gild Hall and I have now stayed there four times - for 2-3 weeks at a time. My first reaction was that the reception area and bar reminded me of an English country town hotel. The smiling receptionist (Amy) on the first occasion I walked in on a snowy and freezing February evening warmed me up immediately, and I don't think I have ever met such a friendly receptionist crew. The bar staff were eqaully friendly. The rooms do vary, some are a bit small and others are - by NY standards - almost massive, but they all seem to be the same price - I suppose corporate rate determines that. Downsides. Breakfast can be very slow (insufficient staff) and is not cheap. The weekend continental breakfast is a joke - there are however a number of ok places nearby at less than half the price. The bar (ex the 5-8 happy hour) is expensive even for NY. As others have suggested, the $10 charge for WIFI use is a disgrace. As one other mentioned, the brownies on the pillow disappeared this year, but I mentioned this to Amy, and that evening................brownies!!

Reviews.Title: “Upmarket stay in a prime Wall Street location”
Reviews.Author: SpivsUKOK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times on business in the last year. Overall very positive experiences. It's certainly at the boutique end of the scale with v. tastefully furnished rooms of a good size - bordering on generous for NYC. Bathrooms are particularly nicely done, with good freebies. Only downsides from my perspective is that the bar is very small and very noisy (when you arrive inn the evenings you feel like you've arrived at a private party) and there isn't really any room service to speak of. It's pricey, but you're paying for an upmarket stay in a prime Wall Street location.

Reviews.Title: “High Price and Low Service”
Reviews.Author: RezaMor
Reviews.Content: We booked a Double Queen bed room in Gild Hall hotel, and we were 3 people. The service was not satisfactory because they even did not provide us with enough Shampoos, Soap. Every we were about to asked them to put these items for us. Also, the size of the room was to small in comparison to the standard of other hotels. However, the place was too convenient to all downtown areas. The breakfast was not included and the price of breakfast, lunch, and dinner was too expensive. The most awful thing was the speed of internet, and you have to pay 10$ per night for the internet. Seriously the speed was awful and comparable to disconnection.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Quiet area.”
Reviews.Author: oliverlevitt
Reviews.Content: 1. It is true that the hotel isn't in midtown, but it is right near a few subway stops, that take you anywhere in the city. 2. The rooms are small in general, but with high ceilings. 3. The furnishings are slightly dated, but in NY who spends allot of time in the room 4. The elevators need to be revamped. 5. The male concierge wasn't so nice and helpful, however there was an Indian woman who works behind the front desk who was so delightful and helpful. Sorry I don't have a better way of describing her. 6. All in all the staff was great. 7. The rooms were spotless. The maid service fabulous. 8. Horrible workout center. 9. The weirdest thing was the bathroom. They are see through. Going to the bathroom can be a bit weird. 10. Overall if the price was right I would stay here again, but wouldn't go out of my way.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: HoneymoonersThailand
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, much more interesting location than the usual midtown hotels. Huge room, great design, great amenities. Somewhat weird design choice with the bathroom - it's basically a glass cube, so when a person uses it in the middle of the night it lights up & illuminates the whole room - usually waking up the other person. Staff was hit or miss; some were nice, some the usual NYC oblivious & snooty. The one serious problem we had with them was we were waiting for a package to be delivered, and even though we alerted them to this daily they managed to miss it & send it back. To us this was a major problem, they didn't seem to particularly care. In spite of this, all in all a very good hotel, fantastic value for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Far below expectations”
Reviews.Author: BritTraveller49
Reviews.Content: Sure the hotel is quiet and in a great location for people who have commitments in the financial district. In other respects though, Gild Hall failed to live up to expectations. While the hunting lodge motif may work in the public areas, it does not in the bedrooms. Some may consider the design 'hip', but we found the colour schemes gloomy. Our room was not particularly clean and had several burnt out lightbulbs - an indication of lack of housekeeping attention. What passed for continental breakfast was a joke. A limited selection of cereals and pastries - the latter stale - and a small bowl of fresh fruit. Customer service was mediocre and inattentive. If this is a reflection of Thompson hotel standards, then our recommendation is to think twice before reserving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in one of the more quieter areas of NYC”
Reviews.Author: TravelTime23_75
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gild Hall for 4 nights and apart from the housekeeping staff forgetting small things such as emptying our bin and our window not being fixed after letting reception know after the first night, it is a cool hotel. The rooms are very spacious compared to others we have stayed at in NY. As the hotel is not on a main road it is also a lot quieter than staying on say 5th Avenue or closer to some of the main attractions. We didn't have breakfast included in our stay, but there is an abundance of places around to eat at for all budgets. The air conditioning is also a bit loud but was good to have it since the temp reach the 90s! Overall it was a very relaxed hotel and we enjoyed staying there. Not such a great location if you want to be in the thick of it as Times Square is a good 40 blocks away. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for work in the financial district of New York”
Reviews.Author: MDGodwin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband ( he was on holiday) and a good friend of mine who was also out here for work. The hotel was lovely, We had a room on the 17th floor. 162 which was lovely although my friends room on the 17th floor room 176 was twice the size. The rooms were modern and nicely furnished. The only complaint was no mirror over the dressing table. There was a flat screen TV instead which my husband was happy about. The loo seat was chipped but they now had soft closing lids which must have been a result of the original lids. The shower was good but could have a been a bit more powerful. All the staff was lovely and friendly. (Although one lady did give us the wrong directions to Lord and Taylor...best place for shoes in NY) And the doorman was gorgeous. Working on Broadway this hotel was perfect. No more than 5 minutes walk. If I was here on holiday it is a bit of a pain as other than century 21 no other major shops are close by but the subways are easy to use if you remember up town and downtown. Good places to eat near by though and I can recommend Mad dog and stones which is a fab mexican about 7 minutes away. Lovely hotel and I would stay there again and I will be giving it a good review for work.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet downtown hideaway”
Reviews.Author: spbyrne
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Gild Hall a few times now and find it a quiet retreat. While it's not the best location in NY it's always well priced, rooms in the upper floors are large and comfortable by NY standards and staff are very nice. My only gripe is NO free WIFI (which is typical of Thompson Hotels) and this needs to change. At $10 per day, figure this into your calculations when deciding on price alone.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel in Financial District”
Reviews.Author: Freiert
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently during a visit to NYC for a friends birthday. While the weather was absolutely horrible, the Gild Hall offered a decent place to get out of the rain. Finding the (pretty small) hotel was a bit of a challenge due to the location, and when we arrived there was no one to Valet our car, and their was only one staff member working the front desk. Once we established that our car would be parked, everything involving check-in/out went fine. The room was on the small side, but was comfortable and nicely appointed...had a cool "millionares hunting lodge" vide. Beds were decent, and everything was clean. I would give this hotel 4 stars, but after checkout we were billed several mystery fees, which ended up adding up unacceptably. The amount wasn't large enough to waste time fighting, but were annoying enough to make me consider other options the next time I'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Wall Street area, but rooms are TINY...”
Reviews.Author: jfk68
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Gild Hall and I do not recall the rooms being so small (even smaller than the rooms at the W Hotel or by typical NY standards). The room was clean and provided what I need, but difficult to relax given the size. On the plus side, the location is very convenient for Wall Street business.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Miserable”
Reviews.Author: drosey12
Reviews.Content: Not only did things not work: remote control for tv; door keys; reading lights; air conditioner and the phone but nobody really cared. They made you feel that you were inconveniencing them by reporting the problems. The location is terrible if you are in NY to see anything and it is really hard to find even after you have been there a few times. Cab drivers never even heard of the street. . They say they have fitness center which is nothing more than a musty room with a couple of machines. Only place I have ever stayed in NY where they couldn't even tell you where to get a NY Times. I wouldn't stay here again if it was free. I am writing from the hotel now and can't wait to leave tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: HHeart
Reviews.Content: Overall, Gild Hall makes a pretty nice impression. It has definite style with a great looking lobby. The concierge was helpful in pointing out the best nearby pizza. It is located near Fulton Street which is connected to many subway lines but is pretty far downtown. The bathroom was nice though a couple tiles looked scratched and there were chips in the toilet. The bed was super comfortable though! Overall it was great but I don't know if it lives up to the price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: IncurableTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two-night stay at Gild Hall. Found a great rate online and decided to give another part of Manhattan a try rather than the usual Time Square. Gild Hall is as described online. Modern but nostalgic, cool but funky. I really enjoyed my stay. My room was on the third floor and had no view. Actually it was pretty dim even during the day as it looked out on an alley. That was fine by me as my nighttime activities made a late morning sleep a necessity. The room was more than large enough for one and would probably be good for two. I wouldn't say the black carpet was low quality as some have commented - it just shows everything right away. The bed was great - super comfy and the sheets luxurious. Never heard a peep in the night or morning. The room was warm until I found the thermostat and turned it from 'warm' to 'cool'. The bathroom was modern and nice, though the shower nobs were a bit confusing at first. Good water pressure. Staff at the front was always super polite and helpful. PLEASE NOTE: The nearest subway station (Fulton St) is under construction thru 2010 on the weekends and is closed Saturday and Sunday. The next closest subway stop is City Hall, which is a good 10 minute walk. If you're a weekend visitor it makes the hike to the hotel less convenient, especially after a long day of walking around town. Your subway line choices are also limited. But for the price it's still a good deal. I would recommend, especially if you're in town to shop at Century 21 and do things other than Broadway shows and don't mind a bit of a walk to things.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lolola1234
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York City about four times a month and have stayed in my fair share of hotels ranging from the 5-star Plaza to the 3-star Tudor Hotel. This is by far one of the best experiences with a hotel in New York. From the moment you are greeted by the door man you notice something different. The lobby is reminiscent of a cabin in Colorado. This is a very "man's man" hotel. Dark woods. Low lighting. Thick wood tables. Low level seating. Shelves of books. The nearby bar demands that you come and have a drink before hitting the streets of New York. The lobby and the attendants assisting you with check-in are not prissy. Yet, there is a great sense of customer service. Different from chain hotels, the employees even partake in being unique wearing trendy clothes that differs from stuffy, old concierge suits at other places. At night, the intimate lobby is filled with hip and young patrons conversing with each other enjoying the ambiance. There are no more than 10 rooms per floor. The rooms are decorated reminiscent of the lobby. Dark woods and rich browns. The headboard of the bed is the length of the wall upholstered in leather. The bathroom while somewhat small is clean bright and tiled in clear tiles. The brown marble floor gives it a clean elegance. The room has a huge brass chandelier that could be found in mountain ski lodge. I would not recommend this hotel if you are heading to New York City for the first time. It is located in the Financial District. It is less touristy then other parts of the city. Instead, if you are returning to New York and want to be amidst trendy residents who probably work in the skyscrapers of the surrounding banks. Or if you want to eat at small, contemporary restaurants with exceptional service and innovate menus catering to the discerning young professional. Then this place is for you. The area empties out after 5pm on a weekday. I believe that is a huge plus. The people that remain in the area are not tourists, instead its the residents. At times, you have the streets to yourself and in New York City that is surprisingly relaxing feeling. Gild Hall has become my number 1 choice while in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice...”
Reviews.Author: pacha23
Reviews.Content: ...although when booking the Guild Hall for two nights over the weekend I was a bit nervous because I was not sure what to expect. After staying there I can highly recommend to everybody to stay at the Gild Hall: 1.) it is a very stylish hotel with a unique design 2.) our room (18th. floor) was huge, clean, with a great bed and very nice bath amenities 3.) the staff was extremely friendly and helpful 4.) the Financial District is my new favourite in NYC - it offers a great and safe neighbourhood experience with restaurants, stores and the subway nearby - not too touristy, but still close to Brooklyn Bridge, Southstreet Seaport, China Town, Wall Street, etc. 5.) great value. I'm loking forward to come back!

Reviews.Title: “3.5/5”
Reviews.Author: JamieKate
Reviews.Content: Great location if you are working downtown or you just want to get away from the general noise of NYC. Brilliant staff, v helpful, responded to all requests quickly. Good bar that has a happy hour from 5-8pm. Downside is that the rooms are nothing special, quite small, dingy, not helped by black carpet. Window blinds that don't shut property, tiny bathrooms and actually overall quite cheap looking with a tartan blanket on the bed and faux leather headboard. I think the prices are v. steep for what you get and in that part of town I think there are better options. One thing I couldn't get over was that if you wanted an ethernet cable you had to buy one ! I wouldn't not stay again, but it wouldn't be top choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: amyhay
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning after an all night flight and were greeted and given helpful information about the city. The staff directed us towards a restaurant to eat breakfast and then after we went out sightseeing we came back and our room was ready early. Overall we loved the staff - they were extremely approachable & had some great information about the city that was really helpful. They were always warm & courteous even when we acted like tourist with some ridiculous questions. We had an amazing time in NYC and contribute much of this to our delightful stay at the Gild. If we went back to NYC we wouldn't think twice before staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fastrack101
Reviews.Content: A marvelous hotel in every way except location. The lobby has a distinct character that mixes ultra-hip with classic old fashioned charm - featuring a cross between an alpine ski lodge and an ivy league library. Terrific value for the amenities. Only drawback is its location down in the Financial District... but it's really just a short subway ride away from the rest of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoCALcanuck
Reviews.Content: Although a little too far downtown for my business meeting(s), I had no regrets about staying at this cool boutique locale. Typical small NYC hotel rooms, but a nice lobby area and good staff

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: emsmom89
Reviews.Content: Very nice and hotel staff were very accommodating. Nicely decorated, very comfortable (and roomy for NYC standards) rooms and very private. I am still questioning the people who wrote reviews about the bathroom see through doors...... what is your problem?? Had never booked with a boutique hotel in NYC before this and now I will never go back to the large chain hotels. This was a quiet place to come back to after a long busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the Financial District”
Reviews.Author: BostonNantwich
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fantastic and great value. Great beds, awesome flat screen tv. Very convienient to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great, QUIET hotel”
Reviews.Author: fubijar
Reviews.Content: A great, quiet location if you plan on using the MTA (and why wouldn't you). Nice comfortable beds and super clean. Close enough to walk to Chinatown for that late night meal. The only potential drawback is the glass separating the bathroom. It is by no means transparent but not quite opaque either. If you're traveling with that not-so-intimate partner, you may be privy to a little more than expected, At the right price, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't tell anyone else - this hotel is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: NewportGuys
Reviews.Content: We felt spoiled by ALL the staff for the whole long weekend. The front office was just the best and every staff member you met walking around the place just couldn't do enough for you. The receptionist said as we arrived from a shopping trip: "Let us take all your shopping to your room while you relax in the bar." When was the last time you heared these perfect words at ANY hotel lately? We upgraded to one of the suites found at the end of each floor, it was huge and SO comfortable. The rooms were large (for NY) but we just decided to have the extra comfort and the bed, bedding - just everything was 1st class. Some people might find the long walk from bed to the loo a problem - we just laughed and said the exercise was good for you! I am a bit of a grumpy OM and can find fault in everything - but we couldn't find anything to complain about. The decor wont appeal to all but then I am not too keen on curry shop swags and tails and gloved butlers - but Gild Hall is just so comfy and relaxed you have to like it. The first floor lounge is just so cosy for a romantic evening .... We are going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if location is right for you”
Reviews.Author: jebndelorus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gild Hall in September 2009, while in NYC for a quick break before heading elsewhere int he US on business. The hotel's great - large rooms, clean, and good value. However, the location could be a down-side, depending what you're visiting NYC for. If you're on business, you're right in the heart of things with easy access to Wall Street etc. For leisure, it's less good. Easy access to Battery Park and the ferries, but beyond that you're facing a subway guide to get anywhere - especially weekends, when a lot of the shops and eateries in the immediate area are closed. Fulton Street subway station is also hideously complicated. Also thought that any hotel charging this much should have free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Downtown NYC”
Reviews.Author: dawn1465
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to spend our 25th anniversary in downtown NYC. I booked the Gild Hall Hotel based on reviews and the location. It was a great choice! It's walking distance to the Seaport, the Hudson River walkway/park, and Battery Park. We wanted to do the Ellis Island Tour and also be able to go on long walks, so this area was perfect. The hotel is a funky little place with a great staff - very friendly and attentive. I lost a shopping bag at the bar one night, and the staff really bent over backwards to help me find it. The even offered to watch the security tape to see if it had been stolen. I've never encountered people so willing to go beyond their job description. The room was a good size - the only strange thing is that the bathroom is walled in with frosted glass blocks, so you can see the person on the toilet. Even after 25 years together, that's just too much information. The bed was very comfortable and there was plenty of closet space. The only bad thing about this location is the lack of places for a good breakfast on the weekend. Since it's a business area, a lot of the surrounding shops are closed on the weekend. The diner that the staff directed us to was horrible. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - convenient location (for us)”
Reviews.Author: jrnyman6
Reviews.Content: Booked this over the phone directly with hotel after several websites (including their own) showed no availability. Location was perfect for us since we have family a block away. Room was above-average size for NY standards, interesting decor, nice atmosphere overall. Only hitch was the smoking room they originally assigned; we had to wait about 1/2 hour to be re-assigned but everything worked out OK. Would definitely recommend this if you're looking downtown.

Reviews.Title: “safe and great location”
Reviews.Author: leoSunnyDorset
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights before moving mid-town. Loved the location as it was perfect for exploring this part of NY and felt very safe at all times of the day and night. the hotel was very comfortable but like other reviewers did not like the bathroom door - very inappropriate. Didn't find the hotel staff particularly friendly, in fact we felt as though we were just about tolerated. They just answered our questions as briefly as possible and never offered any advice or additional information. On the plus side we never heard any noise from outside our room and the bed was extremely comfortable with excellent bedding. There was no iron in the room but we asked for one and it arrived straight away. All in all a good choice of hotel but didn't want to spend time in the lobby as we felt this was quite depressing with no atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nailparlour
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 09, worst weather ever for new york but this hotel was fantastic. Bit difficult to find but once found fantastic. Subways literally around the corner, as is Wall Street, having been going to new york every year for 10 years and this is the first time that I have made it to this area. I found it amazing, there is even a Tiffany store, Trump Hotel but not the same as looking at them in 5th Ave. Going go get the only real negative out of the way.. BATHROOM - OMG.. Four girls in the one bedroom, four crazy irish shoppers into the mix and a bathroom that you can see right into.. Feel sorry for the person who is on the right hand side of the bed, your nose is literally squeezed into the glass, and boy, there is nothing left to the imagination here. Immediate call down to house keeping to tried to do something with a double bed sheet and thumb tacks which kept falling each time some one entered the bathroom but we had to put up with it.. Why on earth cant they just put something on to the glass like a perspex decal or something.. It really is unacceptable. Front desk where always very friendly, the bell hops at the front door where in a league of their own. On the last day they could not have been better. One of the guys went round the block until he got us a taxi van rather than pay for 2 cabs to take us all plus numerous bags to airport. Weekends, this place really does go to sleep, but come monday morning it is bouncing. On arrival we all received complimentary vouchers for drinks which we forgot about. Didnt eat here, but used one of the carts just across street which was gorgeous.. Room service was fantastic, loads and loads of snow white crisp clean towels, shower really powerful and any amount of hot water. Mini bar in room which we emptied to store our own drinks which was a pity. The bedroom was big enough for four, would love to stay again at xmas but the prices are crazy, so if anyone has any good low cost hotels they can recommend please do so.

Reviews.Title: “Gild Hall is right golden.”
Reviews.Author: NaniGoGo
Reviews.Content: Everytime we go to New York, we like to stay in a different neighborhood. This time, we picked Financial District, so Gild Hall (of the Thompson Hotel group) was the best choice for us. We were quite happy with the place, despite being a tiny bit worried about the mixed reviews. The decor is a unique mix of old-boy British club meets Zen simplicity. There were lots of quirky touches, such as a rhino footrest in the lobby, and antler chandeliers. Loads of cushy leather sofas to chill. If the names Wes Anderson and Vivian Westwood mean anything to you, you will appreciate the look and feel of this place. The room: A plaid throw on the bed (which has a huge leather headboard) contrasts nicely with clean undecorated walls. The dark blue industrial grade carpet in the room, however, was jarring against the sumptuous and simple details of the room. Having stayed in a number of NYC hotels, I have to say the room size was pretty generous. Toiletries were spare, but nice, from C.O. Bigelows. No shower cap, or other little extras, just lotion, shampoo, conditioner, bar soap. Oh, and no wi-fi, and they charge 10 clams for internet. Wah? The front desk and service were lovely, the bar was fun, and attracted what seemed like locals and regulars, mixing with out-of-towners. The restaurant Libertine was closed for summer, so I cannot comment on that. But there are tons of bars and restaurants nearby in every direction. Don't be misled by those who say there's nothing down in the Financial District. We found good pizza, old-skool diners, and more. The streets are labyrinthine, so it's not as easy to naviagate as the gridded parts of NYC. Subways are nearby. Overall, this hip cozy lodge was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to S. Street Seaport/Financial District”
Reviews.Author: TripsIM
Reviews.Content: OK, I did have concerns about staying at this hotel, since, I am a female, traveling alone on business. My company wanted me to stay at an affordable hotel within walking distance to the financial district. So, at $199/night this was it. I had a hard time finding it, since it is on a side street, but I was able to find it. It is Art Deco decor and a small, boutique hotel, so there will not be a lavish lobby; but there is someone at the front desk. The staff was very, very nice and made me feel comfortable. I was able to walk to South Street Seaport by myself and no problems at all. I was able to shop, drink and eat. Fun. One of the days, I went to a spa to get a massage in the neighborhood one of the days. And, most of all I found some really great places to eat/shop...Century 21 (the best store on the planet) - within walking distance (about 3 blocks), Crumbs bakery, near wall street - Double YUM and Adrienne's Pizza Bar on Stone Street for the best pizza. It is completely safe. Back to the hotel, the room is very small, the halls are small too. The bathroom doors are dusted class. I wouldn't recommend a family or a couple, at least not the room I was in. Oh, they do have condoms in the room too. Just in case, if you meet someone along the way...;-) They also have a library on the 2nd floor/lounge too. I had a great time. Oh, one more thing, I am also a travel agent and I would recommend this hotel for single travelers or business. Fun and safe and bit of real New York City!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: SabertoothLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a 4 star rating. Pricey hotel for what it offers. No restaurant or food (room service) available in hotel. Why not at least have snacks in the bar? Rooms are clean but really small. I hurt my shin on bed frame. Not enough drawer space for clothes. Closet was ok. No coffee maker or iron in room. Bathroom glass door needs to go (what was the reasoning behind this semi-see through door??). To make matters worse our bathroom door had a defective lock and couldnâ€™t stay shut! We couldnâ€™t believe that they charge $10 per day for the internet! Is this a New York thing? Cheaper hotels have free internet! Staff was great (Friendly and helpful). Hallway decor is nice and unique. We found the lobby somewhat dull. One night there was a wedding party. We tried to get a drink at the bar on the first floor but the wedding guests were hoarding all the space around the bar and some of then seemed reluctant on creating a pathway for us to order our drinks. The bartender seemed unconcerned about us. If you are ever in Chicago, try Hotel Blake. In Washington DC try Hotel Lombardy, you'll see why Gild Hall does not deserve a 4 star rating. These other hotels are rated 3.5 star but are surely 4.5 star based on the Gild Hall rating. They are also less pricey than Gild Hall. But then, its New York! â€¦ the streets around the hotel were full of garbage bags. Wall Street?? More like garbage street. Everything seemd just crammed inâ€¦.. well!

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: TREllis2k
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in July. From the moment I checked in staff were extremely friendly and very happy to answer any questions I had regarding travel and anything else to do with the hotel. The hotel has a lovely decor which has a "trendy" feel to it. The restaurant looked a little pricey and was pitched as "english gastro", being and Englishman myself I steered away from it but from what I could see the food looked pretty good. To be honest, in this location you have thousands of choice of places to eat, so eating in the hotel would be a silly idea anyway, go explore! The business centre was pretty useful, containing a few shared PC's and a networked HP printer (which I used to print directly to from my laptop). The rooms are fully equiped with LCD TV, minibar, bathrobes, wardrobe, and small desk. Other people have mentioned the rooms are a little small, I would agree if we were comparing against other outer city US hotels, but the rooms were pretty much the standard size you get in any European hotels and inner city hotels. A/C in the rooms was great and even with the lovely duck down covers (in summer!) I slept like a baby. The hotel is very close to Fulton street subway which is *fantastic* as it's on stacks of subway lines, you can get anywhere in manhatten very very quickly. It's quite easy to get lost in the maze of streets around the hotel, but this is downtown in the financial district, what do you expect? with a good map you can find it perfectly. The bathroom was great, very clean and bright and a powerful over-bath shower and fully stocked with the usual hotel condiments. Other reviewers have complained about the transparent material used between the bathroom and the room, it is in fact shaded so you can't see through it at all apart from the odd shadow and wouldn't be a problem for people sharing a twin room. My only complaints were: - $10/day for wireless, at a top end hotel pitched towards business this was totally unacceptable, even smaller low-end hotels have free wifi these days. - Wardrobe space was OK, but no drawer space at all, for longer stays a few drawers to store clothes would have been required, with two people in the room we struggled. Otherwise I would highly recommend this hotel for business (since it's a few blocks from wall street) use or for tourists since it's perfectly connected, a short walk from the downtown sites and a 10 minute subway ride from the rest of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service Saves the Day!”
Reviews.Author: seattle2008
Reviews.Content: Like the other review here, I too stayed at the Gild Hall on the night/morning of the atrocious fire alarm. The difference is that I was approached at reception and an immediate, remarkably sincere, apology was extended. Although I was in a hurry to catch a flight the front desk did all they could to mend the wounds of being awoken at such a ridiculous hour (I am from the west coast and had logged a mere 3 hours of sleep!). Throughout my stay I found the front desk to be warm, friendly, funny & helpful (especially Kelli). At this price point I would call the Gild Hall a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended overall”
Reviews.Author: mew20
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom were of a reasonable size, nicely furnished and clean. Wireless internet is an extra 10 USD per day. A few unusual extras were available in the room (condoms etc). The hotel is located in downtown Manhattan which may not be suitable for all though there is a metro station located closeby. The only issue I had was that the fire alarm went off at 0500 on the first night we stayed (followed by an announcement that this was a false alarm). The alarm then repeatedly sounded until the morning though was stopped quickly on each occasion. This meant that it was not possible to get any sleep from 0500. I realise that this is not necessarily the hotel's fault but it would have been nice for the hotel to apologise when we went through reception in the morning, which would have been good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “cool hotel tucked away between seaport and tribecca destinations”
Reviews.Author: jd4795
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the July 4th 2009, very cool hotel, nice common areas, very friendly staff, great access to much of tribecca and the seaport. Its nice to be able to remove your self a bit from the midtown crowds, on a weekend such as the fourth, and still be so close to so much.

Reviews.Title: “The Best! Excellent in every way!"”
Reviews.Author: DMenk17
Reviews.Content: Location, price, staff, room, etc.... perfect. You cannot go wrong with this hotel. It is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Gild Hall is very nicely decorated in the common areas, good location”
Reviews.Author: AbramFroman
Reviews.Content: I rarely stay downtown -- generally in midtown instead. Gild Hall has very nice common areas that are warm and old school feeling in a trendy way. good experience. If I needed to stay downtown again, I would definitely consider again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great atmosphere, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AJBoston5996
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were visiting NYC just for the night to see some friends and decided to get a hotel instead of crashing on someone's couch. Someone recommended Gild Hall and we booked it. The whole stay was great. The front desk staff was friendly and efficient when we checked in (and gave us 2 free drink tickets for the Libertine Bar in the hotel). When we went to the bar before dinner, we had great service again. We ordered the crab cake and when a mix-up in the kitchen caused it to come out somewhat late, we got another free round of drinks unsolicited (we weren't in any rush). The decor was very cool - "modern hunting lodge chic", if I had to define it. The room was comfortable, spacious and clean. The automatic light on the mini-bar was a sleek feature (although, some wires must have been crossed in our room because it turned on and off on its own all night.) My only complaint with the room was the very strange design feature of a frosted glass bathroom. You could see right in from the outside! The hotel isn't in a *great* area of the city as far as Things To Do goes, but it was very quiet and cabs are easy to find. I would definitely recommend a stay at Gild Hall.

Reviews.Title: “The Gild Hall made my first trip to New York a delight!”
Reviews.Author: happy2travel21
Reviews.Content: The staff is excellent - very helpful. courteous and go out of their way to ensure that their guests have what they need. The room was a pleasant surprise in size, accommodating 4 wormen with plenty of suitcases,makeup bags and snacks. The only drawback is as mentioned in previous posts, the glass wall for the bathroom is not everyone's cup of tea. If they would block out the middle section it would help but when the bathroom light was turned on in the early morning it was tough for those who wished to sleep in. We are adaptable so it didn't bug us too much because the rest of the room made up for it. The restaurant for dinner was delicious and the staff there were great.The location is perfect for catching the subway, getting coffee at Starbucks, food nearby at the Deli and walking to South Seaport for a meal. We will be coming back to this hotel when we make a return trip to NY. I was apprehensive about the trip and check trip advisor before I ever book a hotel, so I thought it only fair to give my feedback and say I was not disappointed in my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice at 1st glance, but actually a very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: DQC76
Reviews.Content: We were excited to stay in a boutique hotel by the Thomson Hotel company, and severely disappointed by this overpriced hotel that is not properly maintained. I am a frequent traveller & stay at Marriott whenever possible. Most important to me is a convenient hotel with clean rooms that are functional. My 1st complaint with this hotel is the bar in the lobby that is not cleaned properly. If you arrive at 1pm, 5pm, 10pm or 5am, it smelled of beer and cocktails (as though they were spilled on the floor). But the real "treat" is in the rooms. The room was incredibly small (maybe a little over 200 sq ft), and yet it featured a king bed. There was very little room to store luggage and get around the room. Then there was this misguided notion of a glass wall for the bathroom facing the room (actually, it was pretty much in the room) ... you could exactly see the person in the bathroom & the toilet was right next to the glass wall (that was pleasant!). Also, the rooms and halls were in need of refurbishment. Given the location and price, we expected far more. We stayed at the Sofitel for the last few days of our trip in New York, and had no complaints ... Gild Hall is very, very mediocre and not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: AKas42
Reviews.Content: Good business hotel - great location in Manhattan, quiet yet at the centre of things. Rooms are small-ish, but not at all uncomfortable. Room has fairly good facilities - mini-bar, internet (to pay for), toiletries etc. Would be good if they can shove in a 'reading chair' or sofa ... a single seater. Also a coffee maker is sorely missed!!! Otherwise a very pleasant place. Staff are polite and professional. Hotel has mini-gym on each floor, for the so inclined.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel in Manhattan with service to make you smile”
Reviews.Author: Innuit
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at GildHall for two nights whilst passing through Manhattan but really felt involved and appreciated. The manager and concierge went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and to ensure we had a brilliant time in New York. The room was large and very well appointed and with Kiehls products. It is a little out of the way but we like that, its only a short taxi drive from midtown and Soho and as it is so close to Brookyn bridge its great for an evening stroll. All in all this is the best hotel I've stayed in for a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamadoo06
Reviews.Content: What a superb hotel !! Comfort was excellent, rooms super clean and cosy. Everything was perfect. Staff is really nice and helpfull. Large and comfortable bed. Cookies, ice at arrival, newspaper offered every morning. SUPER QUITE. Breakfast was just ok and we've been charged the Espresso we asked for everyday. Infos : - iPod & iPhone dock in all rooms (charge and listen music) - a great METRO stations at 1 min walk : Fulton st - 5 min walk from Ground Zero / Century 21 (perfect for low price shopping) - Safety box - 5 min walk from the brooklyn bridge!!! WARNING : be aware that Lower Manatthan is a BUSINESS DISTRICT. It means it's crawded on weekdays and dead on weekends. Nothing particular to do at night. If it's your first time in NYC, consider booking an hotel in Midtown East or West.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay... again”
Reviews.Author: businessasusual_9
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several Thompson's in New York and have never been disappointed. While the Gild does not have the Soho/LES/Tribeca address, the quiet neighborhood can be welcoming during the weekends. More importantly, the staff remains on its toes. During our stay, the service was nothing short of excellent. Everyone went out of their way to ensure that we had a great stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the Hipster Hunting Lodge”
Reviews.Author: mare888
Reviews.Content: Gild Hall was the first Priceline hotel we ever stayed at, so we were delighted to have gotten this upscale, funky hotel for only $125 a night. The decor is a very distinctive hybrid of chic and rustic -- to this day we call it the Hipster Hunting Lodge. We'll be happy if our Priceline bid lands us there again. The staff was very courteous, and housekeeping was thorough. There were nice little perks, like the tasty Fat Witch brownies waiting for us, and the overhead lighting fixture that appeared to be made out of a cast iron wagon wheel. The bed was huge and comfortable. Staying in the Financial District is more interesting than you'd think. There was a branch of The Strand Bookstore right around the corner, and plenty of places to eat. By day it's bustling, but at night it's so quiet that you'd think you were in the suburbs. It's perfect for travelers who aren't into night clubbing and partying. The room was lovely, but beware the rooms with glass bathroom doors! I loathe this trend in interior decorating, which seems to be trying to imply that sharing all at potty time is somehow sexy. The glass was frosted, but the toilet is right up next to it and you can see everything. My partner and I adore each other, but we don't go to this level of personal exposure. I don't know if they have some rooms with normal bathroom doors, but you should ask if this is a problem for you (I wish we had). Other than that, we enjoyed the hotel very much and everything worked as it should.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: aussieward
Reviews.Content: Great staff, loved the location & staff. Only 2 minutes away from Century 21 and the TKTS at the Seaport location. We found this hotel on Priceline for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, cozy, fantastic service/staff”
Reviews.Author: theholidaygirl
Reviews.Content: We love Gild Hall - we stayed this past weekend while in town for a wedding. Fantastic decor in both the common rooms & our room. Excellent attention to details: high-end materials, extremely comfy bed & linens, excellent toiletries (Kiehl's). Best hotel bathroom I've ever used. The staff was friendly & attentive without being pushy. Room service was quick & delicious. We slept really well, too. We wish this hotel were a little further uptown, as the financial district is a bit dead, but it was only a short walk to several subway lines. Overall we had a restful, wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, modern, beautiful....I loved it.”
Reviews.Author: hamiltonshabitat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night, alas, on a quick trip to New York. My son, who lives in the west village, warned me about staying in the financial district, calling it "desolate on the weekend". I didn't find that to be true at all. Sure it's not Times Square on a Saturday night, but I hate that. Lots of people were about sightseeing ....with the ferries, Ground Zero, Southstreet Seaport, and residents out walking dogs and shopping for groceries. We picked the Gild Hall, as we got a good rate on Expedia, and it looked lovely. And it was. When we checked in early, they explained that the king room we had booked wasn't ready yet, but for 50 bucks more we could have a suite. I hesitated, and the clerk said.."It's a great suite that normally rents for $300 more a night".....so we said, Sure! Am I glad we did....it was a seriously fab sweet suite....the design in this place (Todd English) is amazing, two big wall flatscreens...both with HD...I wanted to have a party in there it was so cool...gorgeous marble bathroom, with Kiehl's toiletries. In the words of Tina Fey of 39 Rock..."I want to go to there." Subway entrance a couple of blocks away, great pastries and coffee at Financier Pastry also closeby, and an amazing gourmet grocery store Zey Tuna, again, a couple of blocks away. One angst moment ...you have to pay for wireless internet. Come on, Gild Hall!!! Was my 10 bucks worth it?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ChilliScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in the Gild Hotel, and couldn't fault it. From the welcome cookies to the lovely Kiehls toiletries, they made our stay so enjoyable. We have an 8 year old and an 11 year old, and were slightly worried beforehand that a boutique hotel would maybe be not quite the right atmosphere for them but we couldn't have been more wrong. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and botique. Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PhillyCanuck
Reviews.Content: Gild Hall is a modern and funky, boutique hotel right in the middle of the financial district. We stayed for a weekend and enjoyed the property overall. We loved the decor...which we decided was modern, mixed with elements of 60's-70's Europe/Norway. The hotel staff were both friendly and attentive during our stay. Standard rooms are small-ish, but are very well laid out, with all the modern amenities you'd expect to find. The bed and bedding were excellent, soft and comfy. $10 per 24 hours for Internet access wasn't a big deal to us. Like all big cities, there's some street noise. For future improvements, I'd suggest that Gild Hall go for sound-proof windows overall, but once the bankers go home for the day, it wasn't really an issue. Speaking of location, this property is located in the Financial District, so there's not much going on after 5 p.m. If you expect to step out the door and be in the "middle of it all", probably not the right property for you. However, Gild Hall is only a two minute walk from a major subway hub (Fulton St.), where you can pick up the red 2/3 lines and green 4/5/6 lines, (meaning you can get ANYWHERE in New York from this point). We're subway friendly people, so this ended up being a real plus for us. The price for the room was excellent and the location, worked as well. One thing to consider! There's major roadwork being done in the entire district, so getting to the hotel by cab, was a challenge, since many streets were closed off. The entrance is on Platt St. and after we circled around in the cab a few times, we just got out and walked a 1/4 block to the hotel entrance. Not a big deal, just something to keep in mind. Overall? Nice stay, very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Wall Street”
Reviews.Author: Adam M
Reviews.Content: There's a lot to like about Gild Hall- it's a great hotel in the middle of the Wall St. area. Rooms are decently sized, clean, and modern. Cordless telephone, internet access (at a modest fee of $10/day), and flat screen TVs were all amenities. My one complaint would be the desk- not a lot of room to sit down and work. The TV hovers above your head. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean. Kiehl's toiletries are a nice touch. The location is very good if you're planning on spending most of your time downtown, a little less desireable if you're going to be spending time midtown, though subway access is just a block away and can get you to midtown fairly quickly. The restaurant in the hotel was very nice (though the music in the pub is a bit on the loud sound making conversation a little tough. Overall, I'd highly recommend Gild Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel at what must be recession prices”
Reviews.Author: bugleTA
Reviews.Content: Booked a standard room but agreed to an upgrade to a Suite when I arrived. Rate was $200 a night after the upgrade. Suite was gorgeous, wood floors, designer furniture. Hotel as a whole is beautiful. Very clean and well-kept as well.

Reviews.Title: “good but a little odd”
Reviews.Author: dottie dog
Reviews.Content: The good - rooms are nice, well designed use of space and well decorated. Restaurants was good. Odd - well it's very hard to find. My cab driver got quite lost. Location is not well marked so be prepared. No normal public restrooms, they direct you to two rooms on the second floor. just odd. not good - workout rooms (a few little cubicles really) are small, hot, unpleasant. don't expect to work out. They should convert a room to a workout room instead. this is a decent solution if you have to be in lower manhattan, but not my favorite nyc hotel by far.

Reviews.Title: “Good but some disappointments”
Reviews.Author: vanette
Reviews.Content: The bed, linens and cleanliness were all great. The opaque door to bathroom would be odd for most people. But they lied about the parking, straight up. We were told that it was $45 for the 1st 24 hours but if we stayed on after that, it was an hourly rate. Well, a few hours late for the 1st 24, we were charged a full 24 hour rate.And, they pay to park it but you kinda have to let them park it, so you are stuck w/that extra "valet" charge. That parking thing is just wrong. Also, what's up w/charging $5,00 per person for the "bottomless" cup of coffe in the morning? Most hotels, even excellent ones, give you free cooffee. I'd stay there again but I'd scope out parking elsewhere or take the train in and go next door to Starbuck's for my coffee. Also, the brunch menu is outrageously expensive and there are great breakfast places in all directions, 1 or 2 blocks away. Much, much cheaper. Still, the staff was nice. Loved Alex, the bartender.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: dtbPasadena_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gild Hall while looking for apartments in the financial district. The staff was very friendly, helpful and educated in hotel service. Our room (#69-- I suggest that room because it is a King Premium and it has more space-- nice shower!) was quiet and well appointed. The bed and sheets were perfection!!! Better than any Ritz or Four Seasons that we have ever stayed in. I love that they offer Kiehl's products in the room! I am a designer and quite picky, so I had concerns about the noise, etc. We did hear the trash trucks, but at night around 10:00, so no problem. The restaurant (Liberteen) is nothing to write home about in terms of food quality, but the bar is charming! We had a great time there! We did a tour of all of the room types for future reference because we plan to put our family there when they come to visit. I suggest asking for the rooms with the higher ceilings because it makes all the difference! We felt the price of $240 for a premium room (we negotiated that at the front desk when we went in to check out the place) was beyond a great deal! I have to say I did not like the charge for internet (why do hotels do this?), but, as I said, we got such a low rate for the room, that I did not linger on this negative aspect. It is true that car services need to be told to come to the Platt entrance because that caused a delay for us in getting to the airport. The gym needs to be redesigned and given more importance, in my opinion. But, overall, it is a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Shnichol
Reviews.Content: I sent some colleagues to this hotel due to its proximity to the Financial District and the reviews I saw on Trip Advisor. First, the hotel front is not on Gold Street but on Pratt Street and the limo driver would not go to the front. There are no individual temperature controls in the room so it is hard to regulate to individual temperature preferences. The windows do open but the garbage trucks pick up trash at 4:00am and it is very noisey. The bed frame/platform is larger than the mattress so one gentleman kept hitting his shin on the frame. The restaurant serves a limited British themed menu which was not to their liking. I would porbably reccmmend the hotel to a younger person but never again to older executives.

Reviews.Title: “Price was right - clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ballen76
Reviews.Content: 2nd year taking the wife to a Broadway show. Last year we stayed at the Millennium Hilton right next to ground zero - which was nice, very expensive and we had been warned about the 24 hr. construction noise. Went searching for a hotel this year and based on it's reviews alone I booked Gild Hall and I'm glad I did. Let's put it this way: 2 nights here cost me slightly more than 1 night at the Millennium last year. The bartender on Friday night informed us that it had been converted from a Holiday Inn about a year ago to a Thompson hotel. Rooms were cozy, modern, clean and comfortable. Good water pressure in the shower and a nice flat screen on the wall of the room. Really, what more can you ask for? Cabbies had a hard time finding it coming back - there's a lot of construction in that area and even though the hotel is 15 Gold Street one has to enter at Platt. 2 blocks from the Subway, we'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Modern style, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Tripster_Mon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Gild Hall for 2 nights in Feb 09 on a girls weekend in NYC with my mother, and would definitely return. I'd describe Gild Hall as trendy without pretense. The decor is reminiscent of a lodge...lots of dark leather and wood panelling, but it's delivered in a very modern way. The lobby is cozy and inviting (with chess, checkers, and books), and it adjoins a Todd English bar/restaurant (had lunch there...small but good menu). The room was clean, modern and fairly spacious by New York standards. Kiehl's soaps and shampoos in the bathroom...other "amenities" in the mini-bar (not suitable for a mother/daughter getaway, but provided a good laugh.) The hotel was very quiet. There's not a lot of street noise like you'd find in a Midtown hotel. While that's one advantage of the location, some might find it far removed from main attractions in the city (and taxi fares uptown can add up.) And the area is pretty much deserted on the weekends. If you're not too familiar with NYC (and even if you are), navigating the Financial District can be confusing. Personally, I don't mind the location. It's only a few blocks from the subway, and you can often find good deals in the Financial District. So, for my next trip to NYC, I'll definitely look first at Gild Hall!

Reviews.Title: “If you have time to waste and don't mind being aggravated this one is for you”
Reviews.Author: RPDD
Reviews.Content: Gild Hall is listed as being on Gold St. After 40min. of circling with my navigation system on I finally got smart enough to call the Hotel. They are on Platt St. Taxis's can't find this place. The bellman has to go up to the end of the block hop in the taxi and bring the taxi to the hotel. Very time consuming and inconvenient. The Music in the lobby was so loud you couldn't hear the front desk people. Parking was interesting. I called the night before to confirm they had parking. They said yes. What they did not tell me until I arrived is that the parking is$55. per day and per each time you take your car out of the garage. So Plan on taking a taxi if you can find one. The Bathroom was another story One side of the bathroom wall had frosted rippled glass the door had just plan rippled glass, Either way if someone was using the bathroom their was nothing left to priviacy or the imagination. The next biggest disappointment was when we returned to our room to rest at 3:30pm and found our room had not be made up. When I called the front desk to inquire they said that the guest has to request houskeeping. I have never heard of this but more importantly I was not told this at registration. In November I stayed down the street at the Hampton Inn near South Street Seaport. It was my first time there. It was a far better hotel for the same price as Gild Hall. By the way. When the Bellman asked how my stay was and I told him of my complaints he said"We hear the same complaints all the time". Guess who's not listening to their patrons?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: travelboy2000
Reviews.Content: I had originally planned on staying in another hotel - but with the declining dollar and the financial crisis, the Gild Hall slipped into my (Eurobased)budget. I stayed there with my wife a few days before Christmas for her Birthday. We were warmly received on the evening of our arrival and after a speedy check-in shown into our large and nice room (the guest pictures shown here well-reflect what the rooms look like). The cake I had ordered via e-mail was duly delivered on the birthday next morning together with a nice breakfast. Because we couldn't eat the whole cake it was stored for us and taken out on our request (we were even served a complimentary hot chocolate one afternoon) - the cake was too huge to be eaten up completely - and delicious. Except on this one occasion, we never had breakfast here as we were always up and rushed early in the morning for siteseeing. The place appears to fill up as a bar in the evenings although we never made it - always being to exhausted from a day out. The location is absolutely no problem - it does get quiet in the evenings (which is great for light sleepers like myself), but access to nearly everywhere is excellent with well-connected subway stations within a few minutes. The hotel also offers a gym (not seen or tested) and a small internet room with free and fast internet terminals. The the last day there was a pipe burst which put one of the elevators out of service and flooded the 2nd floor bar and lobby - put it was professionally handled and elevators were back in service fairly quickly - it was an exciting little "adventure" while staying there. All in all service is excellent, friendly and very personal and for under 200USD a night, the value for money was great. Thanks to the Gild Hall team for making our stay, my wife's first to New York, so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Boutiquehotelsfan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during the Christmas period for 5 nights. I was impressed with the size of the room given we were in NYC afterall and only paid USD 200 per night. I was initially concern with the location as it is in the financial district, instead of the more usual tourist hotel locations like uptown/midtown/time square. However, the hotel is very close to Fulton station which was very convenient to get to most tourist hot spots. Also, the fact that it is in the financial district (i.e. quieter area at night), was in fact a blessing in disguise especially after spedning the day in busy Manhattan. Hotel service was friendly. The cookies that we received at the start and end of our stay was an added bonus. In summary, I would recommend this hote for those who like a little quiet time at the end of the day, and if you are able to get a good price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Evening”
Reviews.Author: zinka84
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend at Gild Hall for a romantic little getaway, and we had the most wonderful evening. Our room could not have been more comfortable or stylish, yet the fittings seemed more classic than anything. The service was great, the employees were friendly and helpful, and the food at the restaurant was absolutely delicious! I highly recommend the lobster sliders... I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone looking to spend a perfect, quiet night in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alexander M
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Gild Hall Hotel with my partner from monday to friday November 24-28th. Found the hotel to be very stylish, comfortable and in a good location. All the staff were extremely friendly, thanks all! We stayed in another hotel 3 nights prior to our stay at Gild hall and loved the bed in the first hotel. So we were a little worried the bed would not be as nice, but boy does Gild Hall have comfy beds! Large King Size beds with beautiful leather headbords. We checked in around 13:00 and our booked standard room was not ready. We were offered a deluxe room upgrade at 30 dollars plus. We exepted and were not dissapointed. The room was on the 14th floor and had all the ammenities one could wish for. Housekeeping was excellent, front desk extremely helpfull in giving directions and suggestions of places to have breakfast etc. We had breakfast in the hotel once. It was good, service was good, but overall a little pricy for what you get. We had some great breakfasts across the street at the Gold Street Diner.
